reviews.review_msg: a sweetheart. inspirational. kind. funny. i love her. i wish her nothing but peace, fun and whimsy. but holy moly, don't take this course if you don't need it. run for the hills, my fellow english majors. you will learn you NOTHING about english. you will be humbled. you will experience fear. you WILL struggle. a verb is not what you think it is.

Kind engaging professor. Wouldnt take this class if you dont need to though. Got the worst grade Ive ever gotten at SFU. Hard exams. Dont really like the "no email policy about schoolwork"... I understand it takes longer to explain concepts on email, yet a lot of us are commuters who dont have time to drive up the mountain for a simple question.

This course was stressful. She had like 2 group projects and if you get a bad group, you already lose the prospect of getting an A. Eva is one of the nicest professors and she gets along well with the students but her classes are long and boring. If you take this course, get ready to really focus in class!

Utter disaster. The only saving grace was the fact that Eva is kind and likes to get to know the students. The course is boring and stressful. She has a lot of group work so if you don't have a good group, you won't get a good grade. Her grade boundaries are extremely high (95% + for an A+). Terrible choice unless you like Linguistics.

Eva is a very kind and helpful professor. She is very knowledgeable on English grammar. Be fully prepared before each midterm. Read the textbook frequently and have a good command on each point. If you do not work hard , this course will be somewhat tough for you. It is not easy to get A

Lectures were dry and slow to progress through the material, which was sometimes covered ad nauseum. Exams were tricky, but manageable. I enjoyed both of the textbooksthe material interested me. As far as I could tell, she is a fair marker. The practice exams were useful, helped clarify what would be tested. She is also clear in her expectations.
exams are WAY harder than the practice exams and homework she gave out, literally half of the class are seeking help outside the class.
Exams are way harder than practice exams and participation quizs.

She is a nice professor, but her class and exam are not. She uses textbooks a lot. She takes attendance at very beginning of class. The questions in the textbook are totally different from the exam. But, she will give the sample exam questions. I think her exam sentences come from the news, article or journal.

She is really fascinating and amazing prof! She uses the textbooks a lot, but I use them only for homework. You don't need to read the textbooks. You just need to do the homework and review her PPT and you can easily get an A.
